framework

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The implementation of the game engine. All aspects of the game apart from the visual and input-output related ones are implemented in this class.

    The game board is stored as a 3x3 char array. The board size is fixed and many pieces of the code is implemented based on this. The number of players is also fixed to 2.

    The game ends whenever a row or a cell contains the same mark in each cell. There can be at most 9 rounds in the game. When all cells are filled (which takes exactly 9 rounds) and no player wins the game, the result is announced to be a tie.

    Author:
    Cagatay Yildiz
    See Also:
    Board, Player

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String firstPlayer,
            java.lang.String secondPlayer)
        Constructs a new Game. The names of the players in this game is given in the parameters. Their marks are by default set to 'X' and 'O'.
        Parameters:
        firstPlayer - the name of the first player
        secondPlayer - the name of the first player

    • Method Detail

      • runGame

        public void runGame()
        The main loop in this game. In each round, which has a maximum value of 9, if the game is not over, a valid input from the user is being waited. Then the boardArray field and the canvas is updated. If none of the players win the game after 9 rounds, tie is announced.

      • updateBoardArray

        public boolean updateBoardArray(Player player,
                                int posX,
                                int posY)
        Fills a location in a cell with the mark of a player. Zero based numbering is used in the array and the upper left corner is denoted by the tuple (0,0). Moving on a row changes the first value in the tuple whereas it is the second one when moved on a column
        Parameters:
        player - the player whose mark is added to the array
        posX - X position of the cell to be modified
        posY - Y position of the cell to be modified
        Returns:
        true if the location is empty; false, otherwise.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Checks for each row and column in the board that contains a single mark other than the empty position mark.
        Returns:
        true if all cells in a row or column are of the same mark. false otherwise

      • announceWinner

        public void announceWinner(char mark)
        Looking at the mark of the winner, finds and prints its name to the canvas and then kills the program
        Parameters:
        mark - the mark of the winner

      • switchPlayer

        public Player switchPlayer(Player current)
        Returns the player that is not in the parameter
        Parameters:
        current - one of the players
        Returns:
        the other player

      • killTheGame

        public void killTheGame(int milisecs)
        Waits for milisecs/1000 seconds and then terminates the program.
        Parameters:
        milisecs - the amount of waiting duration in miliseconds before the game window is closed.
